Package org.pojava.util

Util contains pure utility code.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Compression This class provides a simplified interface for compressing binary data using the "Deflate" algorithm common to "zip" compression.
DataPump The DataPump class was developed primarily for supporting Runtime.getRuntime().exec(...), where you may need to gather from stdout and stderr simultaneously.
EncodingTool A class for reversible encodings.
Encryption Deprecated.
EncryptionTool This utility provides a simple interface for encrypting and decrypting data using high-quality encryption algorithms such as AES-128 and AES-256.
HashingTool Hashes are numbers, byte arrays or strings that non-uniquely identify data by applying some calculation against a set of data in order to derive a relatively small signature.
ProcessTool This tool runs an external program through your OS, and stuffs the results from stdout and stderr into their own StringBuffers.
ReflectionTool The ReflectionTool class provides static methods for accessing an object's properties.
StringTool A set of methods for performing string manipulation, mostly to support internal needs without requiring external libraries.
 

Enum Summary
HashingAlgorithm A HashingAlgorithm represents a hashing algorithm supported by HashingTool.
 

Package org.pojava.util Description

Util contains pure utility code. In general, when a POJava utility consists of only static methods, it will have the suffix "Tool" at the end. Note that I'm not out to try to duplicate the effort of Apache Commons-- you'll find some excellent utilities there-- rather, I'm seeking to have a small core on which to build some higher level tools without an abundance of dependent packages.
